definition: to swing backward and forward like a pendulum
to move or travel back and forth between two points
examples: he oscillates regularly between his comfortable home … and his downtown office-laboratory

definition: to vary between opposing beliefs, feelings, or theories
examples: The mood of the voters has oscillated between optimism and pessimism.

definition: to vary above and below a mean value
examples: Bank rate oscillates between 2 and 6 percent.
